channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Advancing Arabic Sentiment Analysis: ArSen Benchmark and the Improved Fuzzy Deep Hybrid Network
item.description: Sentiment analysis is pivotal in Natural Language Processing for understanding opinions and emotions in text.

item.title: BEARD: Benchmarking the Adversarial Robustness for Dataset Distillation
item.description: Dataset Distillation (DD) is an emerging technique that compresses large-scale datasets into significantly smaller synthesized datasets while preserving high test performance and enabling the efficient training of large models.

item.title: Heuristical Comparison of Vision Transformers Against Convolutional Neural Networks for Semantic Segmentation on Remote Sensing Imagery
item.description: This paper focuses on the heuristic comparison of three key factors of using (or not using) ViT for semantic segmentation of remote sensing aerial images on the iSAID.

item.title: Adaptive Deviation Learning for Visual Anomaly Detection with Data Contamination
item.description: Visual anomaly detection targets to detect images that notably differ from normal pattern, and it has found extensive application in identifying defective parts within the manufacturing industry.

item.title: The \emph{Optimist}: Towards Fully Automated Graph Theory Research
item.description: This paper introduces the \emph{Optimist}, an autonomous system developed to advance automated conjecture generation in graph theory.

item.title: Image Matching Filtering and Refinement by Planes and Beyond
item.description: This paper introduces a modular, non-deep learning method for filtering and refining sparse correspondences in image matching.

item.title: SINETRA: a Versatile Framework for Evaluating Single Neuron Tracking in Behaving Animals
item.description: Accurately tracking neuronal activity in behaving animals presents significant challenges due to complex motions and background noise.

item.title: SCAN: Bootstrapping Contrastive Pre-training for Data Efficiency
item.description: In particular, we individually pre-train seven CLIP models on two large-scale image-text pair datasets, and two MoCo models on the ImageNet dataset, resulting in a total of 16 pre-trained models.

item.title: Caravan MultiMet: Extending Caravan with Multiple Weather Nowcasts and Forecasts
item.description: The Caravan large-sample hydrology dataset (Kratzert et al., 2023) was created to standardize and harmonize streamflow data from various regional datasets, combined with globally available meteorological forcing and catchment attributes.

item.title: MFTIQ: Multi-Flow Tracker with Independent Matching Quality Estimation
item.description: In this work, we present MFTIQ, a novel dense long-term tracking model that advances the Multi-Flow Tracker (MFT) framework to address challenges in point-level visual tracking in video sequences.

item.title: DROJ: A Prompt-Driven Attack against Large Language Models
item.description: Here, we introduce a novel approach, Directed Rrepresentation Optimization Jailbreak (DROJ), which optimizes jailbreak prompts at the embedding level to shift the hidden representations of harmful queries towards directions that are more likely to elicit affirmative responses from the model.

item.title: An Adaptive Open-Source Dataset Generation Framework for Machine Learning Tasks in Logic Synthesis
item.description: This paper introduces an adaptive logic synthesis dataset generation framework designed to enhance machine learning applications within the logic synthesis process.

item.title: Reducing Reasoning Costs - The Path of Optimization for Chain of Thought via Sparse Attention Mechanism
item.description: In order to address the chain of thought in the large language model inference cost surge, this research proposes to use a sparse attention mechanism that only focuses on a few relevant tokens.

item.title: Building Height Estimation Using Shadow Length in Satellite Imagery
item.description: We addressed this issue by using shadow length as an additional cue to compensate for the loss of building height estimation using single-view imagery.

item.title: Your Fixed Watermark is Fragile: Towards Semantic-Aware Watermark for EaaS Copyright Protection
item.description: In this paper, we reveal that previous watermarking schemes possess semantic-independent characteristics and propose the Semantic Perturbation Attack (SPA).

item.title: DriveThru: a Document Extraction Platform and Benchmark Datasets for Indonesian Local Language Archives
item.description: However, most of these efforts have been focused on creating manual resources thus difficult to scale to more languages.

item.title: MICCAI-CDMRI 2023 QuantConn Challenge Findings on Achieving Robust Quantitative Connectivity through Harmonized Preprocessing of Diffusion MRI
item.description: There is a pressing need to harmonize the preprocessing of DW-MRI datasets to ensure the derivation of robust quantitative diffusion metrics across acquisitions.

item.title: Lattice-based stochastic models motivate non-linear diffusion descriptions of memory-based dispersal
item.description: The advantage of working with the individual-based model is that it is straightforward to propose and implement memory effects within the simulation in a way that is more biologically intuitive than simply proposing heuristic extensions of classical PDE models.

item.title: DTELS: Towards Dynamic Granularity of Timeline Summarization
item.description: The rapid proliferation of online news has posed significant challenges in tracking the continuous development of news topics.

item.title: Rethinking the "Heatmap + Monte Carlo Tree Search" Paradigm for Solving Large Scale TSP
item.description: The Travelling Salesman Problem (TSP) remains a fundamental challenge in combinatorial optimization, inspiring diverse algorithmic strategies.

item.title: DAHL: Domain-specific Automated Hallucination Evaluation of Long-Form Text through a Benchmark Dataset in Biomedicine
item.description: We introduce DAHL, a benchmark dataset and automated evaluation system designed to assess hallucination in long-form text generation, specifically within the biomedical domain.

item.title: Are nuclear masks all you need for improved out-of-domain generalisation? A closer look at cancer classification in histopathology
item.description: Domain generalisation in computational histopathology is challenging because the images are substantially affected by differences among hospitals due to factors like fixation and staining of tissue and imaging equipment.

item.title: Harnessing Vision Foundation Models for High-Performance, Training-Free Open Vocabulary Segmentation
item.description: Specifically, we introduce Trident, a training-free framework that first splices features extracted by CLIP and DINO from sub-images, then leverages SAM's encoder to create a correlation matrix for global aggregation, enabling a broadened receptive field for effective segmentation.

item.title: Local-Global Attention: An Adaptive Mechanism for Multi-Scale Feature Integration
item.description: In recent years, attention mechanisms have significantly enhanced the performance of object detection by focusing on key feature information.

item.title: TockyLocus: Quantitative Analysis Methods for Flow Cytometric Fluorescent Timer Data
item.description: In this study, we introduce rigorous algorithms for a data categorization method, designated as the Tocky locus approach, which uses normalized and trigonometric-transformed Fluorescent Timer data, suitable for quantitative analysis.

item.title: On the Selection Stability of Stability Selection and Its Applications
item.description: This paper seeks to broaden the use of an established stability estimator to evaluate the overall stability of the stability selection framework, moving beyond single-variable analysis.

item.title: LHRS-Bot-Nova: Improved Multimodal Large Language Model for Remote Sensing Vision-Language Interpretation
item.description: In this study, we introduce LHRS-Bot-Nova, an MLLM specialized in understanding remote sensing (RS) images, designed to expertly perform a wide range of RS understanding tasks aligned with human instructions.

item.title: SAFES: Sequential Privacy and Fairness Enhancing Data Synthesis for Responsible AI
item.description: As data-driven and AI-based decision making gains widespread adoption in most disciplines, it is crucial that both data privacy and decision fairness are appropriately addressed.

item.title: A survey of probabilistic generative frameworks for molecular simulations
item.description: In a nutshell, (i) Neural Spline Flows do best at capturing mode asymmetry present in low-dimensional data, (ii) Conditional Flow Matching outperforms other models for high-dimensional data with low complexity, and (iii) Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models appears the best for low-dimensional data with high complexity.

item.title: Interaction Testing in Variation Analysis
item.description: In this way, the TV measure is suitable for providing explanations in the natural regime and answering questions such as ``why is $X$ associated with $Y$?''.

item.title: Confidence-aware Denoised Fine-tuning of Off-the-shelf Models for Certified Robustness
item.description: We also find that such a fine-tuning can be done by updating a small fraction of parameters of the classifier.

item.title: The Structure of the U.S. Income Distribution
item.description: I show that U. S. incomes follow a one-parameter family of probability distributions over more than fifty years of data.

item.title: PyGen: A Collaborative Human-AI Approach to Python Package Creation
item.description: The principles of automation and innovation serve as foundational elements for advancement in contemporary science and technology.

item.title: Hopfield-Fenchel-Young Networks: A Unified Framework for Associative Memory Retrieval
item.description: Associative memory models, such as Hopfield networks and their modern variants, have garnered renewed interest due to advancements in memory capacity and connections with self-attention in transformers.

item.title: Multi-Perspective Stance Detection
item.description: Subjective NLP tasks usually rely on human annotations provided by multiple annotators, whose judgments may vary due to their diverse backgrounds and life experiences.

item.title: Recommender systems and reinforcement learning for building control and occupant interaction: A text-mining driven review of scientific literature
item.description: Despite broad applications, their use in optimizing indoor environments and energy efficiency is limited.

item.title: Minimax Optimal Two-Sample Testing under Local Differential Privacy
item.description: We explore the trade-off between privacy and statistical utility in private two-sample testing under local differential privacy (LDP) for both multinomial and continuous data.

item.title: Refusal in LLMs is an Affine Function
item.description: We propose affine concept editing (ACE) as an approach for steering language models' behavior by intervening directly in activations.

item.title: Deep Learning Accelerated Quantum Transport Simulations in Nanoelectronics: From Break Junctions to Field-Effect Transistors
item.description: Quantum transport calculations are essential for understanding and designing nanoelectronic devices, yet the trade-off between accuracy and computational efficiency has long limited their practical applications.

item.title: LogLLM: Log-based Anomaly Detection Using Large Language Models
item.description: Software systems often record important runtime information in logs to help with troubleshooting.

item.title: MBA-SLAM: Motion Blur Aware Dense Visual SLAM with Radiance Fields Representation
item.description: In our experiments, we demonstrate that MBA-SLAM surpasses previous state-of-the-art methods in both camera localization and map reconstruction, showcasing superior performance across a range of datasets, including synthetic and real datasets featuring sharp images as well as those affected by motion blur, highlighting the versatility and robustness of our approach.

item.title: XiYan-SQL: A Multi-Generator Ensemble Framework for Text-to-SQL
item.description: On the other hand, we implement the ICL approach with an example selection method based on named entity recognition to prevent overemphasis on entities.

item.title: Steady-State and Dynamical Behavior of a PDE Model of Multilevel Selection with Pairwise Group-Level Competition
item.description: Evolutionary competition often occurs simultaneously at multiple levels of organization, in which traits or behaviors that are costly for an individual can provide collective benefits to groups to which the individual belongs.

item.title: Hybrid Vector Auto Regression and Neural Network Model for Order Flow Imbalance Prediction in High Frequency Trading
item.description: In high frequency trading, accurate prediction of Order Flow Imbalance (OFI) is crucial for understanding market dynamics and maintaining liquidity.

item.title: MLV$^2$-Net: Rater-Based Majority-Label Voting for Consistent Meningeal Lymphatic Vessel Segmentation
item.description: Meningeal lymphatic vessels (MLVs) are responsible for the drainage of waste products from the human brain.

item.title: Saliency Map-based Image Retrieval using Invariant Krawtchouk Moments
item.description: With the widespread adoption of digital devices equipped with cameras and the rapid development of Internet technology, numerous content-based image retrieval systems and novel image feature extraction techniques have emerged in recent years.

item.title: VALTEST: Automated Validation of Language Model Generated Test Cases
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated significant potential in automating software testing, specifically in generating unit test cases.

item.title: Parameter Inference via Differentiable Diffusion Bridge Importance Sampling
item.description: We introduce a methodology for performing parameter inference in high-dimensional, non-linear diffusion processes.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks in Supply Chain Analytics and Optimization: Concepts, Perspectives, Dataset and Benchmarks
item.description: Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have recently gained traction in transportation, bioinformatics, language and image processing, but research on their application to supply chain management remains limited.

item.title: Towards Objective and Unbiased Decision Assessments with LLM-Enhanced Hierarchical Attention Networks
item.description: How objective and unbiased are we while making decisions?
